reviewText: Let me start by saying, this is one of those few amines that doesn't have to show fanservice or bloody fight. This anime series is only season 1 & 2. Season 3 is my hope it would be soon. This show is amazing, slice of life, adventure and very educational. Very rear does an anime does such as to educate, this anime is about how the market works. From their, they add a slice of life and a great adventure to make it spice and wolf. From good moments to sad, from jealousy to needing someone you like. From rich to poor to hopefully of a fortune. I can keep going, but think I will bored you. Lol the DVD set come in DVD format and Blu-Ray DVD. They are in their own case, some share from front and back case. Animation is amazing, soundtrack is glamurous and the story is excellent. It does however leave you in a cliffhanger, for hopefully season 3. But so far nothing yet. :( but patience will pay off one day.  Hope you enjoy this series as much as I did. Enjoy.

reviewText: Spice and Wolf is about a traveling merchant in a far off land that finds a naked girl with a tail (Furries rejoice!) in his cart. Turns out she's a Wolf God of Harvest that lost her worshipers when Christianity came in and she's desperate to get back home to the north to spend her days in peace. He reluctantly agrees to take her but only if it's along his way. So she ends up tagging along on his business ventures adding her cute and mischievous talents to them . A friendship grows and more. I would go into more detail but this show is too good for me to spoil.It is a brilliant show made even better by intelligent writing and an amazing voice cast. J. Michael Tatum (Stein's;Gate) as Craft Lawrence and Brina Palencia (One Piece) as Holo. (They reunite later in Black Butler as Sebastian and Ciel for all you geeks out there.)I fell for this show when I watched it on Netflix and patiently waited until it came down enough to buy it on Blu-ray. Well worth the money and you will love this show for sure. Enjoy.
summary: Interesting, sweet, and charming. A must buy in my opinion.

reviewText: I've seen Spice and Wolf online and on TV several times and have enjoy seasons one and two. Its nice to see a regular man like Lawrence helping a pretty women like Holo who also has the ability to turn into a wolf. Its a wonderful story that has comedy, drama mixed it with a bit of romance but not so much that its like a love story. Its also adventurous as they both travel through the countryside from villages, to towns, to even cities as they make their way. I won't tell the story as it would ruin it but I strongly feel there needs to be a season three. I highly recommend getting Spice and Wolf :-)

reviewText: I've only seen the episodes on disc 1 so far, and they're entertaining, but... every time she refers to herself as 'the Wise Wolf' it seems that she's recapping a lesson in market economics. I was sorta hoping that this might be a spinoff from Inuyasha with the she-wolf from the Northern Clans that Koga blew off, but I guess not. I will enjoy this series anyway.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This comment is only regarding the packaging tactics, not the series...I ordered both the first and second season BD boxsets when they were first here on amazon.  But the 2nd season BD got yanked off my order, and I only received the 1st season.  I've now waited a very long time to get the BD only 2nd season, which has never appeared. Now the complete box appears... and I can't get just the 2nd season BDs without getting ripped off by being forced to buy the DVDs, as well.  I have no reason to have DVDs when I have the BDs, and I see no reason to have to pay for them either.This is a deliberate rip-off by whoever is marketing the series in this method, and as far as I am concerned is a very good reason for piracy to bloom.This also goes for Paramount, Disney, Fox, and all the other studios who are pulling this despicable trick.  I am not paying extra because you think sticking in DVDs will fool me.Spice and Wolf: Season Two (Blu-ray/DVD Combo)Spice and Wolf: Season Two (Blu-ray/DVD Combo Limited Edition)Spice & Wolf: Complete Series (Blu-ray/DVD Combo)See, you want the second season, you have to pay for DVDs, as well.
summary: 5 stars for series, no stars for rip-off tactics

reviewText: This anime is not one to buy if you want lots of fight scenes or if your looking for anime babes.  If you want a story that is something unique and different than the norm then this anime is for you.  You learn to admire Holo and Lawrence and their unique way of showing affection for one another.  Its not a fast paced anime but I enjoyed it a lot.
summary: Great Story, great artwork, great characters.

reviewText: Spice and Wolf is a fabulous tale that will sweep you away. Mind you there is no fanservice, but it plays well at the strings of the heart. Each episode unfolds the experiences of the merchants life as he travels from town to town making his living and assisting a surprise companion. Thier story unfolds as does the world in which they live in. Full of rich culture, economics, politics and subpurbly detailed to draw you in and make you feel part of thier world. I promise you will love this show. My teen daughter was glued to it and my 8 year old son had insists on watching it over and over. One truly to be appreciated. Beautiful art, story, animation,and music. Add this to your collection.
summary: Lovebirds that pretend to be angry to hide true feelings.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I must admit when I first turned on the series I was unsure about it, but after a couple of episodes I was hooked and can't get enough. This anime is unlike any I've watched before, (there are plenty of reviews explaining it so I won't go into it here) but despite the fact there is generally little to no action I do find it interesting despite the fact it is mostly about economics and a romance that could possibly be budding between the two.I am saddened that I continually hear that there will be no third season so I have taken to reading the books, yes surprisingly enough the originals are books, not manga, though there is a manga out as well if you'd prefer that but the books are much further along. At this point the books are up to just past the end of season 2 (6 books total at the time of the review with at least 2 more already scheduled to come out, I think the seventh is in December and the eighth in april but I'm sure that is subject to change though.)

reviewText: Spice and Wolf is one of the greatest animes made. It follows the unique tale of a traveling merchant and a demi-god named Holo. Holo is a harvest god, who lives in and draws power from wheat. This is two season ending in what would be considered Book 5 of the light novels. It skips book 4. There is no plans for a third season.Visually the colors are gorgeous, no scaling issues, and audio is clear.
summary: Complete series of a great anime

reviewText: This is Anime - not hentai - there is very little flesh exposed; I suppose that's a spoiler.  Still, this is too much for any youngkid because it is an excellent primer for arbitrage.  The authors plainly had midaevil northern Italy in mind with all the stonebuildings, bridges, churches, etc. and the in-room fireplaces at the inns.The story line is well researched and well-done.  It kept my picky, quirky interest to the last moment.
summary: Arbitrage - or What You Never Knew about it
Title: N/A

reviewText: The series will definitely appeal to many fans once they see the series after an episode or two though if you like more of the action fast paced series like Naruto or Bleach then this one might not be for you.  The series while somewhat slow paced in certain areas is understandable as the writers give you a chance to better know the characters and the situation as the couple travel on their journey, The main two characters are Kraft Lawrence a wandering merchant who during his traveling meets a apparently young woman named Holo who he later finds out is Wolf harvest deity who feels her time has come with staying in the area but also as the villagers who once worshiped her have now started to forsake and forget about her and so wishes to see how the world has changed. The two quickly endear themselves to you with their quirk personalities and plans.  The series has a decent mixture of most genres in it so most people will probably find entertainment in watching the series though again while the series does have action scenes for the most part they creators and writers keep the pace on a more normal pace if you've seen the series [...] then you'll probably be used to the pace of this series as well.The animation is pretty decent and the soundtrack fits the series nicely of course the subbed and dubbed cast were very talented in voicing their character roles, the set itself is pretty much the standard from Funimation combo packs.  The set will give you four regular dvds and four blu-ray dvds, the extras are so-so but I and I think a few others rarely look at the extras so it's not a big issue.  At the end a great series awaits you and for other fans of fast paced animes I say give the series a shot you might be astounded at how entertaining the series really is...
summary: A Entertaining Series With A Equally Good Storyline

reviewText: The interactions between the two main characters are great. The writing is fantastic and their deliveries of the lines (native Japanese voices) are superb. The world they live in is also fun and interesting, and you end up feeling like you have learned something at least a little applicable to our own world. The animation is well done and I feel that Spice and Wolf holds a special place in my heart. Normally I don't like slow anime that is mostly talk and banter, I usually enjoy shows more like Darker than Black and Code Geass. But Spice and Wolf just put everything together well, and it made me actually like the two main characters a lot. This is a show I've watched straight through at least twice, with the first season alone double that many times.
summary: Little Action, But Heartfelt and Funny
